text.content: Dhurandhar Box Office Collection: Day-Wise Earnings & Records in 2026 Skip to content Contact Us Privacy Policy Terms and Conditions Disclaimer Blog Trending Topics Sitemap Facebook Pinterest Twitter Tumblr Menu Menu      Search Dhurandhar Box Office Collection: Day-Wise Earnings & Records in 2026 January 10, 2026 by Ruma Sharma You step into the world of high-stakes espionage with Dhurandhar, a gripping spy action thriller that hit theaters on December 5, 2025. Directed by Aditya Dhar, the film boasts a powerhouse cast including Ranveer Singh in the lead, alongside Akshaye Khanna, R Madhavan, Sanjay Dutt, and Arjun Rampal. Its all about intense drama, patriotic vibes, and edge-of-your-seat action that keeps you hooked. What draws you in? Dhurandhar shattered expectations, emerging as the highest-grossing Hindi film in the post-COVID era. It stormed into the 1000 Crore Club faster than most, outpacing blockbusters like Pushpa 2 in Hindi net collections and even surpassing RRR worldwide. Imagine thata single-language Hindi release without dubbed versions, yet it conquered global charts. You cant ignore its record-breaking run, from massive openings to sustained earnings amid holidays and competition. This dhurandhar earnings saga isnt just numbers; its a testament to star power and storytelling. The film crossed key milestones, like entering the elite club of films with over Rs 800 crore net in India, proving its dominance in the box office report landscape. Day-Wise Box Office Collection in India You want the nitty-gritty on how Dhurandhar built its empire day by day. Net collections reflect earnings after taxes, while gross includes everythingvital for understanding true performance. Factors like weekends, Christmas boosts, and rivals like The Raja Saab influenced the flow. Weekends spiked with family crowds, but weekdays dipped naturally. Dhurandhars dhurandhar box office collection started strong, holding double digits for an astonishing 28 days. Thats rare. Competition from Prabhas The Raja Saab caused a dip on Day 36, its lowest yet. But you see resilience herethe film bounced back. Box Office [January 7, 2026]: Dhurandhar becomes highest-grossing Hindi film; set to beat RRR's worldwide | Entertainment News India TV Welcome User! Read further to know the detailed box office report. Dhurandhar emerged as India's highest grossing Hindi film. Image Source : TMDB Written By: Twinkle Gupta Published: January 08, 2026 9:56 IST , Updated: January 08, 2026 9:56 IST New Delhi: Ranveer Singh 's spy thriller Dhurandhar has become India's highest-grossing Hindi film. Directed by Aditya Dhar, the film saw a dip in its collections during the fifth week, earning single-digit crores on its fifth Friday, but bounced back over the weekend. Despite the slowdown, the film continues to dominate the Indian box office. Notably, it recorded a 62.75% drop on Day 32, its fifth Monday, earning Rs 4.75 crore. According to industry tracker Sacnilk, Dhurandhar has earned Rs 1,222 crore worldwide and is set to surpass the global collection of Jr NTR and Ram Charan's RRR in the coming days. Dhurandhar becomes highest-grossing Hindi film Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar has emerged as the highest-grossing single-language Indian film of all time. The film has been running in theatres for 34 days, earning Rs 786 crore in India. On Day 34, it collected 4.25 crore, with an overall Hindi occupancy of 10.69% on Wednesday, January 7, 2026. The spy action thriller Dhurandhar features an esemble star cast including Ranveer Singh, Akshaye Khanna, Arjun Rampal, Sanjay Dutt, and R Madhavan in pivotal roles. The makers already announced its Part 2, which is set to be released on March 2026, clashing with Yash's Toxic A Fairytale for Grown-Ups. Dhurandhar set to beat RRR's worldwide collection According to industry tracker Sacnilk, Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna's Dhurandhar is closing in on the worldwide collection of SS Rajamouli's RRR. So far, the Bollywood film has earned Rs 1,222 crore globally. For comparison, Jr NTR and Ram Charan's RRR has collected Rs 1,230 crore worldwide. Ikkis box office collection Dharmendra and Agastya Nanda's Ikkis collected Rs 1.15 crore on its seventh day at the Indian box office, bringing its total collection to Rs 24.25 crore. Sriram Raghavan's directorial opened with Rs 7 crore on its first day, followed by Rs 3.5 crore on Day 2, Rs 4.65 crore on Day 3, and 5 crore on Day 5. The film saw its first drop in earnings on Day 5, its first Monday, collecting Rs 1.35 crore. On Day 6, it earned Rs 1.6 crore. Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar Faces 90 Crore Revenue Hit Despite Blockbuster Status; Here's Why - Sacnilk Sacnilk Special News Daily All India Gross Data [Only For Subscribed Users] All India Gross Live Data [Only For Subscribed Users] The Raja Saab First Day Advance Booking Report Jana Nayagan First Day Advance Booking Report Vijay's Jana Nayagan Postponed: A Big Advantage For Sivakarthikeyan-Starrer Parasakthi The Raja Saab Box Office Preview (Hindi): Prabhas-Starrer Heads For A Slow Start Ranveer Singh Starrer Dhurandhar Nears Pushpa 2 Record Ahead of The Second Part's Titanic Clash with Yash's Toxic Drishyam 3 Release Date: Jeethu Joseph Confirms Release Date of Mohanlal-Starrer OFFICIAL: Thalapathy Vijay's Jana Nayagan Postponed; Over 100 Crore in Advance Bookings Wiped Out? Big Advantage for Prabhas's The Raja Saab Vijay's Jana Nayagan Postponed After Censor Certificate Delay Box Office Links Box Office Collection Bollywood Box Office 2024 Tollywood Box Office 2024 Kollywood Box Office 2024 Mollywood Box Office 2024 Sandalwood Box Office 2024 Hollywood Box Office 2024 Gollywood Box Office 2024 Pollywood Box Office 2024 Bengali Box Office 2024 Marathi Box Office 2024 Articles Entertainment Bollywood Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar Faces 90 Crore Revenue Hit Despite Blockbuster Status; Here's Why Views: 9778 | 01 Jan 2026 11:13:42 pm IST | By Christa Lincy Join Us on Google News Aditya Dhar's high-octane espionage thriller Dhurandhar has taken the global box office by storm, shattering records for Ranveer Singh. However, despite its historic collection and All Time Blockbuster verdict, the film has faced a massive financial setback in international territories. According to a verified report by Mid-day, the film has suffered a revenue loss of approximately 90 crore ($10.8 million). The significant deficit is attributed to the film being banned across the Middle East (Gulf countries). Overseas distributor Pranab Kapadia confirmed that the film did not receive clearance from the censor boards in the UAE, Saudi Arabia, Qatar, Kuwait, Bahrain, and Oman. The ban reportedly stems from the film's storyline, which involves an Indian intelligence operation targeting criminal syndicates in Karachi, Pakistan. Regional censors in the Gulf perceived the content as anti Pakistan, a trend previously seen with films like Fighter and Tiger 3. Given that the Middle East is a primary market for Indian action cinema, the absence of a theatrical release there resulted in a direct hit to the film's potential international gross. While 90 crore is a substantial figure that would have further bolstered the film's standing, trade experts suggest the blow was partially mitigated by the December holiday season. Pranab Kapadia noted that many Indian and Pakistani residents living in the Gulf were traveling to the UK, USA, and Canada during the year-end break, where they were able to watch the film on international screens. In North America alone, Dhurandhar has performed exceptionally well, earning over $17.5 million, which has helped offset the losses from the Middle East. Despite the ban, the film's massive Return on Investment (ROI) and record breaking run in India ensure it remains the biggest hit of the actor director duo's career. Despite the significant financial hit in the Gulf region, Dhurandhar continues to maintain an iron grip on the box office. As of its Day 28 (4th Thursday), the film showed remarkable holding power, earning 15 Cr to take its total India Net Collection to a massive 723.25 Cr. The film's overall financial health remains exceptional, with an India Gross Collection of 867.9 Cr and an Overseas Collection of 250 Cr. This brings its total Worldwide Collection to a towering 1117.9 Cr, solidifying its status as an All Time Blockbuster and proving that the film's domestic and other international markets successfully compensated for the missing 90 crore Middle East revenue. Tags Dhurandhar Ranveer Singh Aditya Dhar Akshaye Khanna Box
